meanings.definition: A connection or link between two things or systems.
meanings.sent1: The intertie between the two gears ensures they move together smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The intertie between the internet and computers is crucial for communication.
meanings.sent3: The intertie between the clown's shoes caused him to trip comically.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like an intertie, keeping them close no matter the distance.
meanings.sent5: The intertie between the roots of the trees created a strong network underground.

meanings.definition: To connect or link two things or systems together.
meanings.sent1: I will intertie the cables to make sure the electricity flows properly.
meanings.sent2: She intertied the pieces of the puzzle to reveal the hidden picture.
meanings.sent3: The magician intertied the scarves to create a mesmerizing illusion.
meanings.sent4: His words intertied our hearts, forming a bond that could not be broken.
meanings.sent5: The architect intertied the beams to construct a sturdy building.
